intro: Tetrazygia argyrophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf tetrazygia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
